channel.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
channel.description:
Please! Help! Omg I don't know what to do! Ahh!!!
I have a Client, right? And um..It won't start...
In the batchfile, it says: [b]'java' is not recognized as an internal, or external command, operable program or batchfile.'[/b]
Plz help!

item.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

download Java, set your environmental variables, etc

also, post all batch file related questions/issues in the sticky.

Read full topic

item.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:19, topic:307379”][quote author=Epic Ancient link=topic=403543.msg2988076#msg2988076 date=1255136221]

First go to My Computer. Open your C drive, and go to Program Files. Look for the Java folder. You should see something like jdk1.6.0_#

Then, go to My Computer > View System Information > Advanced Tab > Environmental Variables > Change CLASSPATH to this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_#[/b]\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

The # is from the java directory.

Rewording what I said, but using a different way. He may not have a JDK, though he should.
JRE’s are used to run Java programs, as well.
Either way, it works.
[/quote]
True. I just find it funny, as these ‘noobs’ are telling him to run the client using a server’s runner, when all they want is post count and rep. (Which they aren’t going to get that way.)[/quote]
Who does get it that way? Orite… XP

Read full topic

First go to My Computer. Open your C drive, and go to Program Files. Look for the Java folder. You should see something like jdk1.6.0_#

Then, go to My Computer > View System Information > Advanced Tab > Environmental Variables > Change CLASSPATH to this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_#[/b]\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

The # is from the java directory.
[/quote]

Rewording what I said, but using a different way. He may not have a JDK, though he should.
JRE’s are used to run Java programs, as well.
Either way, it works.[/quote]
True. I just find it funny, as these ‘noobs’ are telling him to run the client using a server’s runner, when all they want is post count and rep. (Which they aren’t going to get that way.)

Read full topic

item.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

First go to My Computer. Open your C drive, and go to Program Files. Look for the Java folder. You should see something like jdk1.6.0_#

Then, go to My Computer > View System Information > Advanced Tab > Environmental Variables > Change CLASSPATH to this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java[b]jdk1.6.0_#[/b]\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

The # is from the java directory.

item.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:15, topic:307379”][quote author=Epic Ancient link=topic=403543.msg2988058#msg2988058 date=1255135740]

Update your classpath. Very simple.

My Computer > View System Information > Advanced Tab > Environmental Variables > Change CLASSPATH to this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Make sure your JDK files are in your Program Files > Java folder.

It’s all very simple.
[/quote]
This will only work if he has jdk 1.6 update 16.[/quote]

Well then he can spend 5 minutes downloading it, can’t he?
If not, I feel bad for him.

Read full topic

@echo off java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause

sad didnt work…

[/quote]
It’s not working because you’re trying to run the server with the client files.[/quote]

plzzz fukin help!!!

Read full topic

Update your classpath. Very simple.

item.title: Server help -!-!_!_!-!-
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

right click edit then Change your java version to 16.

Client runners do not load a java version. They load from directly from the java directory, which includes no specific version.

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:8, topic:307379”]@echo off java -Xmx1024m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.17-ga-bin.jar server pause[/quote]
This is a server runner.[quote=“Mercifies, post:6, topic:307379”]Create a copy of your client then change the copied version’s run.bat to:

@ECHO OFF echo Legendzz Client V2 JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI[/quote]

[quote=“Lord of fallen Angels, post:1, topic:307379”]Please! Help! Omg I don’t know what to do! Ahh!!!

I have a Client, right? And um…It won’t start…

In the batchfile, it says: ‘java’ is not recognized as an internal, or external command, operable program or batchfile.’

Plz help![/quote]
You need to open your client files, and look for the main file, usually called gui.java, or egui.java, but as you said the egui didn’t work. Your client may be loading from a gui. If you have the gui.java, or gui.class, you need to go to the batch file and make it say:

@ECHO OFF
echo Client
JAVA -Xmx500m GUI

Read full topic
